messages: 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (21:12): got to love that the XHTML2 WG is public now: "there is actual money value in efficiency boost by using XML and namespacing; tag soup devalues and compromises accessibility"
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (21:13): also, "GJR: XBL draft dangersously underspecified"
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (21:14): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e2: pointers?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (21:14): http://www.w3.org/2007/10/03-xhtml-minutes.html#item03
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (21:15): there's also some stuff about the non-namespaced role= solution not being forward-looking
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (21:17): ah, they discussed aria
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:22): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: well, the spec currently says to bail if the mime type doesn't match. but we'll see. :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:26): "XBL draft dangersously underspecified"?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:26): who's GJR? i should ask him for feedback
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:26): It's Gregory
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:26): aha, gregory
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:27): pm'd you contact info in case you don't have it
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (21:28): i can't extract actual feedback on the aria proposal form the minutes
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:29): hey dreamhost fixed my jabber problem at last
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:32): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, maybe you could add examples to <datatemplate> that illustrate how it replaces repetition templates and such?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:33): man, have you seen these minutes? http://www.w3.org/2007/10/03-xhtml-minutes.html#item02
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:33): "WG decided to declare victory -- text/html is the media type, that's that -- then we thought better of it and switched it back"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:33): there are so many things wrong with that... i don't know where to start
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:33): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: yeah, i need to fill in the intro section
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:37): right. asked him for feedback. hopefully he can send me links to the underspecified parts, so i can fix them.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:38): oh lol, role= will depend on CURIEs
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:38): what's a curie again? i thought it was a unit of radiation.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:39): per the XHTML2 WG it's an abbreviation of URIs
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:39): ah
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (21:39): abbreviations aren't usually longer than the word they're abbreviating
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:39): foo:bar expands into http://example.org/#bar if foo is bound to http://example.org/#
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:40): ah so it's a qualified name?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:40): qualified names don't expand into URIs
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:40): they expand into a namespace local-name tuple
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:41): {http://www.example.org/#, bar} and http://example.org/#bar seem the same to me, except for some syntactic details
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:42): it's also that bar in this example is no longer restricted to a being a NCName
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:43): seems quite trivial these days to register MIME types btw
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:44): lordy, whatwg seems to be taking up the slack now that public-html has stopped being high-traffic
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:45): e-mail on the whatwg list or something else?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:45): yes
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:47): hmm, which e-mail?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:47): i just mean that as traffic to public-html has gone down, traffic to whatwg has gone up
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:48): oh

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:48): hsivonen: re how do we avoid <datatemplate> turning into a programming language: i think we'll define escaping to JS in the first version. i'm just not sure what the syntax should be yet.
